results.title: The Pleiotropic Effects of Simvastatin on Retinal Microvascular Endothelium Has Important Implications for Ischaemic Retinopathies

results.title: ACP Journal Club. Intensifying glucose control and adding fenofibrate to simvastatin each reduced progression of retinopathy in type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: Intensifying @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ control and adding @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ each reduced progression of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@.

results.title: Medical management of diabetic retinopathy: fenofibrate and ACCORD Eye studies.
results.text_hl: In ACCORD Eye, @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ (160 mg daily) with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ resulted in a 40% reduction in the odds of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ progressing over 4 years, compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Wright AD, Dodson PM. Medical management of diabetic retinopathy: fenofibrate and ACCORD Eye studies. Eye (Lond). 2011 Jul;25(7):843-9. PMID: 21436845
citations.BibTeX: @article{21436845, title={Medical management of diabetic retinopathy: fenofibrate and ACCORD Eye studies.}, author={Wright AD and Dodson PM}, journal={Eye (Lond)}, volume={25}, number={7}, pages={843-9}}

results.title: Does combination therapy with statins and fibrates prevent cardiovascular disease in diabetic patients with atherogenic mixed dyslipidemia?
results.text_hl: Furthermore, in the ACCORD study the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@/@CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ combination significantly reduced the rate of progression of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ compared with statin/placebo administration in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@.

citations.NLM: Agouridis AP, Rizos CV, Elisaf MS, Filippatos TD. Does combination therapy with statins and fibrates prevent cardiovascular disease in diabetic patients with atherogenic mixed dyslipidemia? Rev Diabet Stud. 2013 Summer-Fall;10(2-3):171-90. PMID: 24380091
citations.BibTeX: @article{24380091, title={Does combination therapy with statins and fibrates prevent cardiovascular disease in diabetic patients with atherogenic mixed dyslipidemia?}, author={Agouridis AP and Rizos CV and Elisaf MS and Filippatos TD}, journal={Rev Diabet Stud}, volume={10}, number={2-3}, pages={171-90}}

results.title: Reducing vascular events risk in patients with dyslipidaemia: an update for clinicians.
results.text_hl: Therapeutic lifestyle changes and combination @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering therapy with drugs targeting @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherogenic dyslipidaemia@@@ (such as @CHEMICAL_Fibric_Acids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D058607 @@@fibrates@@@ or innovative drugs targeting @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherogenic dyslipidaemia@@@ and/or @GENE_APOB @GENE_338 @@@apolipoprotein B(100)@@@ metabolism) on top of background statins, have a potential to reduce RvR in high-risk groups, as shown in the Action to Control @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@Cardiovascular Risk@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@ (ACCORD) trial, in which combination therapy with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ decreased macrovascular risk in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ and @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherogenic dyslipidaemia@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ risk irrespective of baseline @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@.

citations.NLM: Hermans MP, Fruchart JC. Reducing vascular events risk in patients with dyslipidaemia: an update for clinicians. Ther Adv Chronic Dis. 2011 Sep;2(5):307-23. PMID: 23251757
citations.BibTeX: @article{23251757, title={Reducing vascular events risk in patients with dyslipidaemia: an update for clinicians.}, author={Hermans MP and Fruchart JC}, journal={Ther Adv Chronic Dis}, volume={2}, number={5}, pages={307-23}}

results.title: [Noninvasive analysis of retinal microstructure and function: challenges and a promising future].
results.text_hl: In clinical studies, we found that the RBF decreased in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ with no or mild @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ compared with healthy subjects.

citations.NLM: Yoshida A. [Noninvasive analysis of retinal microstructure and function: challenges and a promising future]. Nippon Ganka Gakkai Zasshi. 2013 Mar;117(3):212-44; discussion 245. PMID: 23631255
